channel.title: Law School TA Drafts
channel.itunes:subtitle: Law School TA Draft Recordings
channel.itunes:author: Kasey Baughan
channel.itunes:summary: Stanford Law graduate Kasey Baughan takes you through the first year of law school. We will start with a brief overview of the US legal system generally, and then move to contract law, tort law, criminal law, and the other subjects you'd typically cover in the first year of law school. Join our PodTalk Section 3 group at https://podtalk.app.
channel.description: Stanford Law graduate Kasey Baughan takes you through the first year of law school. We will start with a brief overview of the US legal system generally, and then move to contract law, tort law, criminal law, and the other subjects you'd typically cover in the first year of law school. Join our PodTalk Section 3 group at https://podtalk.app.

item.title: Contracts: Hamer v Sidway
item.itunes:summary:
Learn about this classic case of an uncle who bribed his son to sober up.
Court of Appeals of the State of New York 1891
https://casetext.com/case/hamer-v-sidway
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamer_v._Sidway
item.description:

item.itunes:author: Kasey Baughan

item.title: Contracts: Consideration Intro
item.itunes:summary: The foundation for all contracts is both sides offering consideration. Learn what counts as consideration and its limits.
item.description: The foundation for all contracts is both sides offering consideration. Learn what counts as consideration and its limits.
item.itunes:author: Kasey Baughan

item.title: Contracts: Introduction
item.itunes:summary: Learn why contracts are a fundamental building block for society.
item.description: Learn why contracts are a fundamental building block for society.
item.itunes:author: Kasey Baughan

item.title: Ambiguity in the Law
item.itunes:summary: Using the law to resolve disputes always results in some degree of ambiguity. Learn how judges address ambiguity and still come to a resolution.
item.description: Using the law to resolve disputes always results in some degree of ambiguity. Learn how judges address ambiguity and still come to a resolution.
item.itunes:author: Kasey Baughan

item.title: Hierarchy of Law
item.itunes:summary: The basic hierarchy of laws in the US legal system starts with Consitutional Law, and works its way down to the Common Law. This is important background knowledge to have before we begin studying case law.
item.description: The basic hierarchy of laws in the US legal system starts with Consitutional Law, and works its way down to the Common Law. This is important background knowledge to have before we begin studying case law.
item.itunes:author: Kasey Baughan

item.title: Intro
item.itunes:summary: Meet the host and find out what this podcast is all about.
